items.title: Trump signs bill to release Jeffrey Epstein case files after fighting it for months
US: Donald Trump says he signed the bill to release Epstein files
items.standfirst: The fallout from Jeffrey Epstein’s abuse of minors continues to shake Washington, D.C., years after his death. On Tuesday, the US Congress passed a bill requiring the Justice Department to release all files related to the convicted sex offender. President Trump reversed his earlier opposition over the weekend after it became clear the bill would pass both chambers, moving these documents a major step closer to becoming public.
items.content: The fallout from Jeffrey Epstein’s abuse of minors continues to shake Washington, D.C., years after his death. On Tuesday, the US Congress passed a bill requiring the Justice Department to release all files related to the convicted sex offender. President Trump reversed his earlier opposition over the weekend after it became clear the bill would pass both chambers, moving these documents a major step closer to becoming public.

items.title: Trump signs bill ordering US justice department to release Epstein files
items.standfirst: The bill gives the US Justice Department 30 days to release all the files in a searchable format.
items.content: The bill gives the US Justice Department 30 days to release all the files in a searchable format.

items.title: What's next now that Trump has signed a bill releasing the Epstein files
items.standfirst: President Trump has signed a bill to compel the Justice Department to make public its files on the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Now, there's a 30-day countdown for the DOJ to produce those records.
items.content: President Trump has signed a bill to compel the Justice Department to make public its files on the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Now, there's a 30-day countdown for the DOJ to produce those records.(Image credit: Evan Vucci)

items.title: Trump says he's signed bill to release Epstein files

items.content: President Trump said Wednesday he has signed a bill that requires the Justice Department to release files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein within 30 days.

items.title: Trump signs bill releasing Epstein documents amid fears of cover-up
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump signed the Epstein Files Transparency Act on Wednesday, ordering the release of government records on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The bipartisan move marks a reversal of his previous opposition, but lawmakers warn redactions or ongoing investigations could limit full disclosure of Epstein’s network and connections.
items.content: US President Donald Trump signed the Epstein Files Transparency Act on Wednesday, ordering the release of government records on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The bipartisan move marks a reversal of his previous opposition, but lawmakers warn redactions or ongoing investigations could limit full disclosure of Epstein’s network and connections.

items.title: Trump says he's signed bill to release Epstein files
items.standfirst: President Trump said he signed a bill on Wednesday night requiring the Justice Department to release files about convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The DOJ now has 30 days to make the files public.
items.content: President Trump said he signed a bill on Wednesday night requiring the Justice Department to release files about convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The DOJ now has 30 days to make the files public.

The files are expected to be released in a searchable format.

items.standfirst: LONDON — A former United Nations investigator who wrote the authoritative report on the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi told NBC News on Wednesday that she was “shocked and angry” at President Donald Trump’s dismissal of intelligence saying Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman approved the killing

items.title: Trump says US will sell F-35 stealth jets to Saudis as Prince Mohammed visits
items.standfirst: Kingdom’s de facto ruler to arrive on first White House trip since killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi in 2018Donald Trump is to welcome Saudi Arabia’s de facto ruler, Mohammed bin Salman to Washington on Tuesday, in a red-carpet visit expected to result in the sale of highly advanced US F-35 fighter jets to the Gulf monarchy.The crown prince’s arrival in Washington will be his first White House visit since the 2018 killing of the Washington Post journalist and critic of the kingdom Jamal Khashoggi. The CIA later determined Khashoggi’s murder was approved by the crown prince, leading to global condemnation. Continue reading...
items.content: Kingdom’s de facto ruler to arrive on first White House trip since killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi in 2018Donald Trump is to welcome Saudi Arabia’s de facto ruler, Mohammed bin Salman to Washington on Tuesday, in a red-carpet visit expected to result in the sale of highly advanced US F-35 fighter jets to the Gulf monarchy.The crown prince’s arrival in Washington will be his first White House visit since the 2018 killing of the Washington Post journalist and critic of the kingdom Jamal Khashoggi. The CIA later determined Khashoggi’s murder was approved by the crown prince, leading to global condemnation. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Chinese woman who became Philippines mayor gets life for human trafficking
clusters.neutral_headline: Alice Guo, Chinese national who ran huge scam centre while Philippines mayor, sentenced to life in prison

items.title: Chinese woman who became Philippines mayor gets life for human trafficking
items.standfirst: Alice Guo, who lied about her identity, recruited foreign nationals to carry out online scams, say prosecutors.
items.content: Alice Guo, who lied about her identity, recruited foreign nationals to carry out online scams, say prosecutors.

items.title: Alice Guo, Chinese national who ran huge scam centre while Philippines mayor, sentenced to life in prison
items.standfirst: Guo, who pretended to be Filipina to become mayor, found guilty of human trafficking after raid on compound where more than 700 people were forced to run scamsAlice Guo, a Chinese national who became a mayor in the Philippines while masquerading as a Filipina, has been sentenced to life in prison along with seven others on human trafficking charges, state prosecutors have said.Guo, who served as mayor of a town north of Manila, was found guilty of overseeing a Chinese-operated online gambling centre where hundreds of people were forced to run scams or risk torture. Continue reading...
items.content: Guo, who pretended to be Filipina to become mayor, found guilty of human trafficking after raid on compound where more than 700 people were forced to run scamsAlice Guo, a Chinese national who became a mayor in the Philippines while masquerading as a Filipina, has been sentenced to life in prison along with seven others on human trafficking charges, state prosecutors have said.Guo, who served as mayor of a town north of Manila, was found guilty of overseeing a Chinese-operated online gambling centre where hundreds of people were forced to run scams or risk torture. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Alice Guo, a Chinese national, was sentenced to life in prison for human trafficking.
Guo pretended to be Filipina to become mayor in the Philippines.
She oversaw an online gambling center where people were forced to run scams.
More than 700 people were forced to run scams or risk torture.
Guo and seven others were found guilty of human trafficking charges.

clusters.title: Federal judge to resume contempt inquiry into Trump officials
clusters.neutral_headline: Federal judge to resume contempt inquiry into Trump officials

items.title: Federal judge to resume contempt inquiry into Trump officials
items.standfirst: A federal judge is continuing his investigation into whether the Trump administration defied court orders in a high-profile immigration case involving the Alien Enemies Act, he said Wednesday.
items.content: A federal judge is continuing his investigation into whether the Trump administration defied court orders in a high-profile immigration case involving the Alien Enemies Act, he said Wednesday.

items.title: Top judge resumes contempt inquiry into Trump El Salvador deportations
items.standfirst: James Boasberg demands sworn testimony to determine whether US officials defied March court orderA federal judge on Wednesday said he was resuming his long-stalled court proceeding to determine whether Trump administration officials willfully violated a court order by deporting hundreds of men to El Salvador in March.US district judge James Boasberg said he would demand sworn testimony from administration officials to determine whether they defied his March court order to turn around aircraft that were removing the men from US territory. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

ai_summary: A federal judge will resume a contempt inquiry.

The case involves a high-profile immigration matter.

The judge will demand sworn testimony from officials.

clusters.title: Trump Takes Aim at State AI Laws in Draft Executive Order

items.title: Trump Takes Aim at State AI Laws in Draft Executive Order
items.standfirst: The draft order, obtained by WIRED, instructs the US Justice Department to sue states that pass laws regulating AI.
items.content: The draft order, obtained by WIRED, instructs the US Justice Department to sue states that pass laws regulating AI.

items.title: State AI Laws to Be Challenged Under Forthcoming Trump Order
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump is preparing to sign an executive order that would allow the Department of Justice to sue states over artificial intelligence regulations it deems unconstitutional, according to a draft making the rounds on K Street, Capitol Hill, and seen by Bloomberg Government.
items.content: President Donald Trump is preparing to sign an executive order that would allow the Department of Justice to sue states over artificial intelligence regulations it deems unconstitutional, according to a draft making the rounds on K Street, Capitol Hill, and seen by Bloomberg Government.

items.title: Trump Plans ‘Genesis Mission’ to Boost US AI Development
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump plans to roll out a “Genesis Mission” as part of an executive order to boost US artificial intelligence efforts on Monday at the White House, according to a Department of Energy official.
items.content: President Donald Trump plans to roll out a “Genesis Mission” as part of an executive order to boost US artificial intelligence efforts on Monday at the White House, according to a Department of Energy official.
